summary: A "toy library" refers to a community-based initiative that provides access to a diverse range of toys for children, promoting social inclusion and educational development. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, toy libraries may be subject to compliance with safety standards and regulations outlined in the General Product Safety Directive. These libraries foster a culture of sharing and sustainability, aligning with EU policies aimed at reducing waste and encouraging resource efficiency. By facilitating access to play materials, toy libraries contribute to child development and community engagement, reflecting the EUâ€™s commitment to enhancing quality of life through innovative social services.
